companies.name: Google
companies.description: Global tech giant known for search, cloud, and AI

companies.name: Adobe
companies.description: Creative software and digital media company

experiences.tips:
1. Focus heavily on Data Structures and Algorithms - practice LeetCode medium to hard problems daily.
2. System Design is crucial - study Designing Data-Intensive Applications book.
3. Behavioral questions follow the STAR format - prepare 5-6 strong stories.
4. Mock interviews helped me a lot - do at least 10 before the actual interview.
5. Google cares about clean, readable code - practice writing code without an IDE.

rounds.description: 2 coding problems in 90 minutes. First was a medium-level array problem, second was a graph-based hard problem. Used Google's custom coding environment.

questions.questionText: Given an array of integers and a target sum, find all unique pairs that sum to the target. Handle duplicates efficiently.
questions.answerApproach: Sort the array first, then use two pointers from both ends. Skip duplicates while iterating. Time: O(n log n), Space: O(1)

questions.questionText: Design a function to find the shortest path in a weighted graph where you can remove at most k edges to make them cost 0.
questions.answerApproach: Modified Dijkstra with state (node, edges_removed). Use priority queue with tuples (cost, node, k_remaining). Track visited states.

rounds.description: 45-minute technical interview via Google Meet. Started with introductions, then dove into a coding problem. Interviewer was friendly and gave hints when stuck.

questions.questionText: Implement an LRU Cache with O(1) get and put operations.
questions.answerApproach: Combine HashMap for O(1) lookup with Doubly Linked List for O(1) removal and insertion. HashMap stores key -> node reference.

questions.questionText: How would you extend the LRU Cache to handle cache invalidation based on TTL?

rounds.description: First onsite round focused on algorithmic problem solving. Had to write production-quality code.

questions.questionText: Given a stream of integers, find the median at any point efficiently.
questions.answerApproach: Maintain two heaps - max heap for lower half, min heap for upper half. Balance sizes. Median is from top of one or average of both.

rounds.description: 45-minute system design round. Was asked to design a URL shortener like bit.ly. Had to cover all aspects from high-level architecture to database schema.

questions.questionText: Design a URL shortener service like bit.ly that can handle millions of URLs.
questions.answerApproach: Key components: Base62 encoding, hash collision handling, read-heavy so use caching (Redis), NoSQL for scale, CDN for redirects. Consider analytics, rate limiting, custom aliases.

rounds.description: Behavioral round focusing on Google's culture fit. Questions about teamwork, handling ambiguity, and past projects.

questions.questionText: Tell me about a time when you had to deal with ambiguity in a project.
Describe a situation where you had a conflict with a team member and how you resolved it.

experiences.tips:
1. Microsoft values problem-solving approach over just getting the right answer.
2. They ask follow-up questions, so be prepared to optimize your initial solution.
3. System design round tests practical knowledge - they prefer Azure examples.
4. Strong focus on OOP principles - brush up on SOLID principles.
5. Be ready to discuss your projects in depth - they dig into technical decisions.

rounds.description: 3 coding problems in 75 minutes on Codility. Mix of easy, medium, and hard problems.

questions.questionText: Reverse words in a string while preserving whitespace positions.
Find the longest substring without repeating characters.
questions.answerApproach: Use sliding window with HashSet to track characters. Expand right, shrink left when duplicate found. Track maximum length.

questions.questionText: Serialize and deserialize a binary tree.
questions.answerApproach: Use preorder traversal with null markers. For deserialization, use queue or recursive approach with index tracking.

rounds.description: Coding round with focus on problem-solving. Interviewer was very helpful and collaborative.

questions.questionText: Design and implement a thread-safe bounded blocking queue.
questions.answerApproach: Use mutex locks and condition variables. Implement enqueue that blocks when full and dequeue that blocks when empty.

rounds.description: System design focusing on scalability and Azure services.

questions.questionText: Design a notification system that can send push notifications, emails, and SMS to millions of users.
questions.answerApproach: Use message queues for decoupling, different workers for each notification type. Priority queues for urgent notifications. Rate limiting per user. Consider Azure Service Bus, Event Grid.

rounds.description: Discussion about career goals, Microsoft culture, and compensation.

questions.questionText: Why do you want to join Microsoft?
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

experiences.tips:
1. Amazon's Leadership Principles are EXTREMELY important - prepare 2-3 stories for each principle.
2. Every behavioral question should be answered using the STAR format.
3. Coding rounds are timed strictly - practice speed coding.
4. Bar raiser round is tough - they specifically try to find weaknesses.
5. System design expectations are high even for SDE-1.

rounds.description: 2 coding problems + work simulation test. Coding was on Amazon's platform.

questions.questionText: Find k closest points to origin from a list of points.
questions.answerApproach: Use max heap of size k. For each point, calculate distance and maintain heap size. Can also use quickselect for average O(n).

questions.questionText: Merge k sorted linked lists into one sorted list.
questions.answerApproach: Use min heap to always get the smallest head. Alternative: divide and conquer, merge pairs recursively.

rounds.description: Pure coding round with LP questions woven in.

questions.questionText: Design a data structure that supports insert, delete, and getRandom in O(1).
questions.answerApproach: Use HashMap for O(1) lookup and ArrayList for O(1) random access. For delete, swap with last element.

questions.questionText: Tell me about a time when you had to deliver results under a tight deadline.

rounds.description: System design with heavy focus on scalability and AWS services.

questions.questionText: Design Amazon's order processing system.
questions.answerApproach: Event-driven architecture with SQS/SNS. Saga pattern for distributed transactions. DynamoDB for orders. Consider inventory management, payment processing, notification service.

rounds.description: Deep dive into leadership principles and past experiences. This round was challenging.

questions.questionText: Tell me about a time when you disagreed with your manager and how you handled it.
Describe a situation where you had to make a decision with incomplete information.

experiences.tips:
1. Flipkart focuses a lot on problem-solving and coding skills.
2. Machine coding round is unique - practice LLD problems.
3. They ask about Java/Spring Boot internals if you mention them.
4. System design questions are often e-commerce related.
5. HR round is straightforward but be prepared for salary negotiation.

rounds.description: 3 coding problems focusing on DSA. Medium to hard difficulty.

questions.questionText: Find all anagram substrings in a string.
Minimum cost to connect all cities using roads (MST problem).

rounds.description: 1.5 hour round to design and implement a parking lot system. Focus was on clean code and design patterns.

questions.questionText: Design and implement a parking lot system with multiple floors, different vehicle types, and pricing.
questions.answerApproach: Use Strategy pattern for pricing, Factory for vehicle creation. Implement ParkingLot, Floor, Spot classes. Consider threading for concurrent access.

rounds.description: DSA-focused round with 2 problems.

questions.questionText: Implement a rate limiter using Token Bucket algorithm.
Find the maximum sum subarray of size k.

rounds.description: Final HR round discussing expectations and fitment.

questions.questionText: What are your salary expectations?

experiences.tips:
1. HackerRank test is challenging - practice hard problems.
2. They value knowledge of financial systems - read about trading platforms.
3. Strong emphasis on data structures and complexity analysis.
4. Coderpad round requires you to explain while coding.
5. System design round focuses on low-latency systems.

rounds.description: 5 problems in 120 minutes. Mix of coding and SQL questions.

questions.questionText: Implement a function to evaluate a mathematical expression string (including parentheses).
SQL: Find the top 3 customers by transaction volume in each region.

rounds.description: Live coding session with 2 interviewers. Had to code and explain simultaneously.

questions.questionText: Design and implement a thread-safe singleton with lazy initialization.
Find the longest increasing subsequence in an array.
questions.answerApproach: Use DP with binary search for O(n log n). Maintain array of smallest ending elements for each length.

rounds.description: Discussion on Java internals, multithreading, and system design.

questions.questionText: Explain how HashMap works internally in Java. What happens during a collision?
Design a real-time stock price aggregation system.

rounds.description: Behavioral round with senior managers.

questions.questionText: Tell me about a project you're most proud of.
How do you handle working under pressure?

sampleQueries: What kind of questions does Google ask for SDE interviews?
How to prepare for Amazon's behavioral rounds?
What are common system design topics at Microsoft?
Tell me about Flipkart's machine coding round
What is the difficulty level of Goldman Sachs interviews?
What resources should I use for DSA preparation?
How important are leadership principles at Amazon?
What's the typical interview process at Google?
Give me tips for cracking MAANG interviews
What topics should I focus on for coding rounds?
